public class ConvexShape extends org.jsfml.graphics.ConvexShape
Specialized shape representing a convex polygon.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConvexShape

      public ConvexShape()
      Constructs a new empty polygon.

    • ConvexShape

      public ConvexShape(int points)
      Constructs a new empty polygon and allocates a certain amount of points. This is equal to calling setPointCount(int) directly after construction of the polygon.
      Parameters:
      points - the amount of points of the polygon

    • ConvexShape

      public ConvexShape(int points, boolean centered)
      Constructs a new empty polygon and allocates a certain amount of points. This is equal to calling setPointCount(int) directly after construction of the polygon.
      Parameters:
      points - the amount of points of the polygon
      centered - whether this polygon has to be kept centered
      See Also:
      • Shape.setCentered(boolean)

    • ConvexShape

      public ConvexShape(@NotNull @NotNull Vector2f... points)
      Constructs a new polygon from a given set of points. This is equal to calling setPoints(com.rubynaxela.kyanite.math.ConstVector2f...) directly after construction of the polygon.
      Parameters:
      points - the points of the polygon

    • ConvexShape

      public ConvexShape(boolean centered, @NotNull @NotNull Vector2f... points)
      Constructs a new polygon from a given set of points. This is equal to calling setPoints(com.rubynaxela.kyanite.math.ConstVector2f...) directly after construction of the polygon.
      Parameters:
      centered - whether this polygon has to be kept centered
      points - the points of the polygon
      See Also:
      • Shape.setCentered(boolean)

  • Method Details

    • setPointCount

      public void setPointCount(int pointCount)
      Sets the amount of points that belong to the polygon.
      Parameters:
      pointCount - the amount of points of the polygon

    • setPoint

      public void setPoint(int index, @NotNull @NotNull Vector2f point)
      Sets a point of the polygon.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the point to set. Note that this index must be within the bounds of the polygon's point count, i.e. the point count needs to be set properly using setPointCount(int) first
      point - the point to set at the given index

    • getPoints

      public Vector2f[] getPoints()
      Description copied from class: Shape
      Gets all the points of the shape.
      Overrides:
      getPoints in class Shape
      Returns:
      an array containing the points of the shape

    • setPoints

      public void setPoints(@NotNull @NotNull Vector2f... points)
      Sets the points of the polygon. The use of this method equals consecutive calls of setPointCount(int) and setPoint(int, com.rubynaxela.kyanite.math.Vector2f) for each point in the given array.
      Parameters:
      points - the points of the polygon
